metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5279 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Mozilla Firefox before 49.0 allows user-assisted remote attackers to obtain sensitive full-pathname information during a local-file drag-and-drop operation via crafted JavaScript code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5279` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 49.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 49.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 49.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 49.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '49.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
